executiveSummary: Entrepreneurs Justin Randle and Bart Lamont from Dallas, Texas, pitched their company Robin, a high-tech robotic lawn care service, seeking $500,000 for 5% equity on Shark Tank. The founders demonstrated their subscription-based robotic mowing service and explained its environmental and operational benefits. Despite interest and praise from the Sharks, no investment deal was made due to concerns over valuation, capital intensity, and long return horizons.
nextSteps: The founders will likely continue to grow Robin independently, focusing on expanding robotic installations and converting existing customers to the robotic lawn care model.
